reviews.text: I had to rush back to Auckland for family reasons and wanted a great 2 bedroom apartment for me and any others whom needed a bed. The Chatham was perfect in that the apartment was large, modern, clean, great tech and excellent views. The staff there did everything they could do to make my stay a pleasure. The hood is fine and you have plenty of choices of food and drinks with in walking steps away. There was no street noise at all but I did face the harbor not the street. The hotel is a great find and will stay again if the occasion arises. This is a well kept secret.
reviews.title: Great Apartment Hotel in CBD Auckland

reviews.text: We were thrilled to get a two bedroom apartment at such a reasonable rate. Upon arrival in daylight it looked great. Secure underground parking for just $20 was a bonus. The apartment was well equipped. Our delight quickly evaporated when both Friday and Saturday nights we were kept awake by the yelling, swearing and fighting that carried out outside the building. Tis carried on until 5:30am in the morning both nights. Not a great sight when we went for a walk Sunday morning and there was a body lying right by the front door that we had to walk around..... Great apartment - not a great area that it is located in... Real shame. The staff however, were friendly and helpful and made the stay a pleasure. The other residents were also friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great apartment - shame about the location

reviews.text: We got the winter warmer deal which is excellent value for money. Easy parking in the basement, friendly staff including the manager Franz and in the room was everything we needed. One of the lifts was out of order and in one of our bedrooms you heard the neighbours door opening and shutting but who cares? On the strength of the other good things about our stay we booked again this time for 1 week! Highly recommend this place.
reviews.title: Friendly place great value really nice and clean rooms

reviews.text: The Chatham is NOT your typical hotel -- it is a former apartment building that has been converted to a boutique type hotel. Services are minimal -- there is no room service, no pool, no turn down service, not chocolates-on-the-pillow at night. That is MORE than made up by everything else! We had a two bedroom suite with complete kitchen that was simply incredible. Like the nearby Amora, this hotel is close to the Auckland Hebrew Congregation, but for Observant Jewish travelers, the rooms are all on (physical) keyed locks, not electronic keys, which makes it all the more appealing! Just can't say enough nice things about this property!
reviews.title: What a hidden gem!

reviews.text: We had a fantastic stay at The Chatham! We were having a relatively last minute family get together in Auckland, and were finding it hard to find any accommodation that wasn't going to blow the budget - until we found The Chatham. They were easily the most budget-friendly apartments we found, and we were pleasantly surprised at how modern & comfortable they were.
reviews.title: Great Budget Accom.

reviews.text: My partner, brother and I stayed here for the first time after booking a mystery deal on Wotif and we truly couldn't of been happier. Check-in was quick, check out was even quicker and staff were so helpful and understanding.
reviews.title: cheap rates for amazing accomodation!

reviews.text: Our room was so lovely, we had a view of the Sky Tower even though we were on the first floor, which was a great surprise. Yes, if you opened the door it was noisy but Auckland is exactly that; a noisy, busy place. It didn't bother us at all.
reviews.title: Excellent service, perfect location

reviews.text: The size and decor of the room were great, I would love to stay here again and most definitely will when we come back!
reviews.title: Great Staff

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for about 3 weeks, and was very pleased by the friendly staff, nice rooms/apartments and a perfect location. The room had every facility I could need (cutlery, washing machine, oven, ...), a nice bathroom and a beautiful view. And not to forget, very good beds.
reviews.title: Flexible Living
Don't be "put off" by the lobby - it's a good hotel!
reviews.text: Big thank you to the staff at The Chatham for making us feel so welcome, helping us when we lost our way, when we lost our child (big child, but child nevertheless) and when we lost a passport! Nick in particular was extremely helpful and has great local knowledge and even though he was probably sick of the sight of us, didn't show it! We took advantage of the Grab One accommodation offer but were never treated like cheapskates or given second rate rooms. The rooms were great and the "noise" was nothing more than you would expect staying in the city and for us only added to the atmosphere - you see people out in their gym gear walking or jogging while others are still dancing away at the night club. The fire alarm did go off, but if smokers went outside where they were supposed to, it wouldn't happen. There were five of us and we would all stay there again! Thanks heaps.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Serviced apartments are not usually our go but the price was irresistible. The upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite was to die for; top floor with a balcony (for my smoking partner). There was a bus circuit route to the CBD maybe 15 paces away and 50 cents per trip with a bus every 10 to 15 minutes. Just around the corner was K road with a few low cost places to eat. We were there for 3 nights which included a Saturday but the noise wasn't a problem. (Both the Fire Station and Ambulance are close by.) Would happily go back, very comfortable and convenient.
reviews.title: What an up-grade!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through Wotif and it was a mystery property. We had no idea where it was in the Auckland CBD. We were delighted to find it was just a short walk down to the Aotea Centre, The Edge, the Town Hall and the rest of the CBD. It was also just off Karangahape Road so quite a characterful area. Parking on site was excellent. We had a two bedroomed apartment with a balcony which was a lovely surprise. Fabulous outlook in two directions, light and airy and very well equipped. The two bathrooms had everything needed and showers were really good. The beds were also very comfortable. We only stayed for a night on this trip to Auckland but we will definitely return. The staff we met were very helpful and considerate. We were certainly very happy with the way it all turned out.
reviews.title: Great value. Suited us very well.

reviews.text: Having a girls night out in the city, we booked 3 double suites for the night.
reviews.title: Awesome apartments... pity about the noise

reviews.text: The rooms were fantastic - spacious, fully equipped kitchen with nice big fridge/freezer, laundry, 2 bathrooms, 2 bedrooms (king or twins in each), lounge and dining. Cannot fault the rooms on appearance or what was in them. They were spotlessly clean and modern.
reviews.title: Superb...... must stay

reviews.text: There was an ipod docking station for our music as well as a DVD player.
reviews.title: Great Value but a little noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on 14 April - great location, easy to find (was a bit strange the lobby being down the side of the building - not on Pitt St). Very nice, spacious lounge, kitchen (we had 2 bed apt), beds and pillows were very comfy. It would be nice to have chairs and a table on the balcony - lovely view of the Sky Tower. Very convienent bus stop for the city just up the road outside the church (50c great value)
reviews.title: Great location but noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only downside was the noise - we overlooked the Fire Station - lots of noise from people around and about in the early hours but great for people watching from balcony. Should have slept in the room away from Pitt St side. If you want bars & clubbing on the weekend this is perfect - but a quiet night sleep hmmm but yes it is the city. Plus some other apts were quite noisy / music etc when they returned even though there is a no party rule etc.
reviews.title: Great Budget Place

reviews.text: The fact that this place is in the red light district makes it great beacuse you can watch all the CrAZy action from you balcony - it is a bit bit noisy, however if you shut the doors its fine. The rooms are very clean - we had a one bedroom which is more like a studio facing pitt street. This hotel would be great for single guys looking for a date as there are plenty of womon on every corner downstairs. Apart from that, Aucklands Red light district is got to be the cleanest in the world. I wouldnt reccomend this hotel for somone looking for a quiet getaway- This place suits a younger crowd. After two nights we moved onto the Hilton and we really glad for some peace and quiet, however we had a great time at the Chatham as we got to see a bit of the seedy underbelly which we never would otherwise.
reviews.title: Good location with nice apartment

reviews.text: I love the fact that it is near to Queen Street,a block away.it is also near to karangahape road( full of night clubs,Pubs and eatery places).
reviews.title: Great spot.Great service and lovely room.

reviews.text: The apartment is well furnished,well equipped kitchen and modern interior..I will definitely stay here again if I visit Auckland.
reviews.title: champagne style on a beer budget
